author: Staff Reporter
text:
A special team of Child Line stopped a child marriage scheduled to be held on Thursday at Muthalamparai village panchayat in Kadamalaigundu-Mayiladumparai union here on Wednesday.

The parents of a 17-year-old girl, studying Plus One, had arranged her marriage.

Acting on a tip-off, Child Line coordinators N. Chandra and N. Muneeswaran, and panchayat president M.P. Pichai Gani stopped the marriage after convincing the parents.

They explained the ill-effects of child marriage and its impact on the girl’s health to them.

Advice to parents

They also advised them to wait for the girl to complete 18 years of age to perform her marriage.

The coordinators briefed them on the benefits and financial assistance they would receive from the government for a legal marriage.

Later, the parents called off the marriage and assured the Child Line coordinators that they would wait for one more year to perform the marriage of their daughter.
title: Child marriage stopped
